comment.text: This translation key is used for the label "Spreadsheet" which appears on a button in the "Actions" dropdown menu, allowing users to create a new spreadsheet. It is also used as part of a dialog and links within the application, consistently displaying the term "Spreadsheet". The text should be translated to appear cohesively across these different contexts.

usage.context: {t("Document")}, {t("Spreadsheet")}, {t("Presentation")},

<Text
 fontSize="15px"
 fontWeight="600"
 className="settings_unavailable"
 >
 {t("LogoForEditors", { editorName: t("Common:Spreadsheet") })} (
 {logoUrls[8].size.width}x{logoUrls[8].size.height})
 </Text>
 <div className={styles.logosWrapper}>
 <Logo
 name={logoUrls[8].name}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Աղյուսակաթերթ" while technically meaning something close to "spreadsheet," isn't the standard or most natural-sounding term in Armenian. It sounds a bit constructed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more common and readily understood translation would be "մարտավահաշիվ" (martavahashiv) or "հաշվապատճեն" (hashvapatchyen).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ຄຳນວນ' (kham-nuan) means 'calculate' or 'compute', which is not a direct translation of 'Spreadsheet'. A spreadsheet is a document or file used to organize data, not necessarily a calculation tool.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Possible alternatives include: ແຜ່ນແຜ່ນຂຶ້ນ (phaen phaen khuen) - sheet, or ເອກະສານແຜ່ນຕາຕະລາງ (ek-ga-san phaen ta-ta-ralang) - spreadsheet document.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "Прорачунска табела" is a literal translation, it's not the standard or most natural way to refer to a spreadsheet in Serbian. It sounds overly formal and technical.  "Рачунска табела" is the more common and readily understood term.

While 'Elektronik tablo' is a valid translation for spreadsheet, it is quite literal. A more common and natural translation would be 'Excel tablosu' (referencing the popular Excel software) or simply 'Tablo'. 'Elektronik tablo' emphasizes the electronic aspect which isn't always necessary or expected.
